revised_title: Structure-Property Correlations in Thermotropic Liquid Crystals
tldr: This article explores the influence of molecular structure on the properties of thermotropic liquid crystals, focusing on rod-like molecules. It discusses the challenges of understanding structure-property correlations and the importance of molecular shape and packing in determining liquid crystal phase behavior. The article also highlights the complexities of smectic polymorphism and the role of molecular dipoles in promoting specific smectic phases.
